flaw_description: When computing CSI on the MeteoNet dataset the paper originally used the same thresholds as for SEVIR, which makes the skill-score evaluation invalid.  Reviewer 7mGa pointed this out and the authors agreed, providing a new table with revised (12,18,24,32) dBZ thresholds and promised to update the camera-ready paper accordingly. Correct thresholds are necessary for any fair claim of skill-score improvement.

flaw_description: Reviewers stressed that the experimental evaluation is still incomplete: (i) no direct comparison with earlier non-MSE loss functions for precipitation nowcasting, and (ii) limited evidence of benefits on the current state-of-the-art models such as NowcastNet, DiffCast, etc.  The authors acknowledged this, citing computational constraints, and committed to add further discussion/results (e.g. SimVP-v2 results and clarification of when FACL helps) in the final version. A broader benchmark is required to substantiate the claimed generality and superiority of FACL.
